snippet: The elegant new smartphones aim to answer many criticisms leveled at Samsung’s phones but are most likely not quite enough to fix what ails the company.
abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of the Art column predicts that Samsung's latest top-of-the-line Galaxy smartphones will most likely fail to address company's declining market share due to their lack of compelling software; notes that while company has addressed oft-repeated complaints about their phones' looks, it has not been successful in offering users useful suite of unique software.
lead_paragraph: The elegant new smartphones aim to answer many criticisms leveled at Samsung’s phones but are most likely not quite enough to fix what ails the company.

headline.print_headline: Samsung Aims High, but Phones Fall Back to Earth
headline.main: With Galaxy S6 and S6 Edge, Samsung Tries to Regain Its Footing
